title: 15-year-old girl killed by two masked gunmen in north St. Louis
content:
ST. LOUIS - Police are investigating after a 15-year-old girl was shot and killed Tuesday night.
According to the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department, the shooting happened just before 7 p.m. in the 6000 block of Thekla Avenue in north St. Louis.
Police said witnesses saw two masked gunmen armed with assault rifles who opened fire on the girl while she sat in a car. Police said the girl, a student at Northwest Academy of Law high school, was on her way home from a basketball game.
St. Louis Public Schools identified the victim as 15-year-old Toni Stevenson. They say she played basketball, soccer, and volleyball.
Police say Stevenson was shot multiple times. When police arrived on the scene, the victim was not conscious or breathing. She was declared dead on the scene.
Homicide detectives are investigating.
“Toni was a very popular child, a very bright future, played three different sports, was a member of their civic organizations here at the school, so a lot of tears being shed this morning for the loss of a very bright student," said Patrick Wallace, executive director of communications for St. Louis Public Schools.
A crisis team has been activated for both students and staff to give them an opportunity to grieve in whatever way they need to grieve. It's made up of counselors and social workers from throughout the school district.
